channel.title: #153: “What should I do with Saber Feedback?”
channel.description:
I seek @freyfogle's advice on some [Saber Feedback](https://saberfeedback.com/) stuff. We talk about pricing, free plans, legacy framework woes, and database hosting.
We also chat about:
* running [Geomob](https://thegeomob.com/) as an online conference instead as a COVID alternative to an in-person conference * automating away common customer support enquiries
<iframe height="200px" width="100%" frameborder="no" scrolling="no" seamless src="https://player.simplecast.com/73b07896-452c-4f58-b919-34c3c1fe51ca?dark=false"></iframe>
[You can also listen to this episode here](https://bootstrapped.fm/153-what-should-i-do-with-saber-feedback/).

item.title: #153: “What should I do with Saber Feedback?”
item.dc:creator: unboot
item.description:
Good advice from @freyfogle !
Do only what is really necessary.
Regarding your idea to go to AWS/S3 for storage: If you are afraid your disk goes full with png’s, just buy Linode block storage and attach it to your server. It’s a bit like a larger disk for your server. That works well for png’s, but not for the database.
About ember: Ember is for people who like ember. If you are not into ember, migrate away. I would consider this as necessary for you.

Read full topic
item.source: #153: “What should I do with Saber Feedback?”
